value.title: Power BI: How to Write any DAX Measure In Just 3 Easy Steps 👣
value.excerpt: Are you struggling to write DAX Measures? In this video I explain 3 Simple Steps that Non-Techie Business Users can take to write any DAX Measure. 👉 Get Power BI Training: https://www.LearnPowerBI.com/training 👉 Get Power BI Advanced Training: https://www.LearnPowerBI.com/advance  ==Table of Contents==

value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. If you are doing the distinct count in Power Query as part of a group by operation, however, the existing distinct count is for all columns in

value.title: Getting Started with Data Pipelines in Fabric Data Factory

value.title: Power BI Report Server   Power BI On Premises Hosting
value.excerpt: Power BI is not only a cloud-based reporting technology. Due to the demand for some businesses to have their data and reporting solutions on-premises, Power BI also has the option to be deployed fully on-premises. Power BI on-premises hosting is called Power BI Report Server. This post concerns using

value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns
value.excerpt: You can create relationships in Power BI between tables. Relationships are useful for some functions to work across multiple tables and produce the result. Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect

value.title: What is Power BI Dataflow and Why you should use it
value.excerpt: Dataflows are an important component in the Power BI architecture. Using them can enhance the development and maintenance of your Power BI solution significantly. However, there are many Power BI implementations that are not using this functionality, even though it is already more than three years passed

value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Reading active Power BI security roles in DAX
value.excerpt: How to read the active security roles in a Tabular model for Power BI or Analysis Services by using a DAX measure. This way, you can use measures and calculation groups to customize a report based dynamically on security roles active for the current user. Article and download: https://sql.bi/803102?aff=yt

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
